results.title: Lady and the Tramp
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Walt Disney, Hamilton Luske, Clyde Geronimi and Wilfred Jackson
results.brief_description: Lady, a pampered cocker spaniel, and Tramp, a jaunty mutt with a heart of gold, join an equally delightful cast of characters for an animated masterpiece. It’s an enthralling story, breathtaking animation and memorable songs, (written and performed by the legendary Peggy Lee) provide unparalleled romance, adventure and enchantment. Rated: G

results.title: Lacombe Lucien [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Nouvelles Éditions de Films, Universal Pictures France, VIDES Cinematografica, Hallelujuh and Louis Malle
results.brief_description: Lucien Lacombe (Pierre Blaise) is a young peasant trying to make ends meet in Nazi-occupied France. Bored with his job cleaning in a country hospital, he first tries joining the Resistance, then the Gestapo, in his search for excitement and to earn some extra cash. He puts his own success as a collaborator at risk, however, when he finds himself falling in love with, and then exploiting, the daughter of a Jewish tailor (Aurore Clement). Using an almost detached camera, Louis Malle’s controversial film is a verite-style drama of corruption, apathy and amorality. Young Lucien’s succumbing to the allure and promises of the Nazis’ is not an isolated act but a response to the casual war profiteering, prostitution and opportunism that he sees the adults around him engaging in. What is truly shocking is the ease with which people are shown becoming accustomed to the most vile and extreme acts of torture and genocide. Malle’s discreet and circumspect mise-en-scene resists manipulating the viewer through sensationalism or moral self-righteousness; Lucien’s descent is all too identifiably human. On it’s release “Lacombe Lucien” was widely acclaimed as one of the director’s greatest films, but it was also savagely maligned as a betrayal of the heroism of the French people, and a betrayal of the promise and hopes of the Resistance (a criticism echoed by both left and right). In the end, “Lacombe Lucien” is one of the few films that can be argued to not only de-romanticise our most popular conceptions of war, but also manages to deal effectively, bravely and unforgettably, with the “banality of Evil”. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: La Strada
results.creator_credit: Ponti-De Laurentis, Dino De Laurentiis, Carlo Ponti and Federico Fellini
results.brief_description: In this film Fellini uses the metaphor of a journey to explore what was to become one of his favourite themes - the search for meaning and purpose in life. Gelsomina (Giuletta Masina), a simple-minded peasant girl is sold to the circus strongman, Zampano (Anthony Quinn). As she accompanies him on tour through the countryside, she bercomes the victim of his constant abuse until their meeting with a circus performer (Richard Baseheart) dramatically changes their lives. This was the film that established Fellini as one of the leading lights of European Cinema.

results.title: La Marseillaise
results.creator_credit: La Compagnie Jean Renoir, Andre Seigneur and Jean Renoir
results.brief_description: Renoir financed “La Marseillaise” entirely from public subscription. The film traces the fortunes of two young men during the French Revolution. Renoir’s characteristic warmth and faith in human nature is prominent, and he concentrates on portraying the lives of ordinary people during the revolutionary period. This is one of the few great films to deal seriously with this momentous time in history.

results.title: La Ceremonie
results.creator_credit: MK2 Productions, Canal+, Olga-Film, France 3 Cinema, Marin Karmitz and Claude Chabrol
results.brief_description: Chabrol has called this sinister psycho-drama revolving around issues of class conflict and familial discontent “the last Marxist film”. Based on the novel ‘A Judgement in Stone’ by Ruth Rendell the film centres on a wealthy liberal couple living in rural Brittany who employ Sophie, a taciturn young woman, as a live-in maid. Initially satisfied with her work they become disapproving when she forms a close bond with the irreverent local postmistress. Their strange friendship and increasingly odd antics make the family increasingly suspicious of Sophie and when they finally reject her, the two friends exact a chilling revenge. This film is widely considered to mark Chabrol’s return to form as a director of thrillers. Cast includes Isabelle Huppert, Sandrine Bonnaire, Jacqeline Bisset and Jean-Pierre Cassel.

results.title: La Cage aux Folles II
results.creator_credit: Productions Artistes Associes, Paris Da Ma Produzione, Marcello Danon and Edouard Molinaro
results.brief_description: Comic sequel to the phenomenally popular French farce about aging gay couple Renato and Albin—the proprietor and main attraction of a Riviera drag cabaret. This time Renato’s suggestion that Albo is a bit too mature to impersonate a young Marlene Dietrich sets off a series of madcap adventures. When Albin, dressed in drag, is picked up by a spy escaping enemy agents, the couple unwittingly find themselves innocent victims of a murderous espionage ring and are forced to flee, escaping to Italy in an mishap packed cross country journey to hide out on Renato’s family’s farm. The hilarity continues as Albin finds that his attractiveness has not diminished after all, when he becomes an object of lust for a group of lonely farmhands. The comic talents of Michel Serrault, and the chemistry between him and Ugo Tognazzi are a highlight of the film. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: La Cage aux Folles 3: the wedding
results.creator_credit: Columbia Films, Da Ma Produzione, Marcello Danon and Georges Lautner
results.brief_description: Third and final installment of the “La Cage aux Folles” comedies begins with the St. Tropez nightclub of the title in serious financial trouble. When club owner Renato learns that his lover and the club’s star drag artiste Albin, is about to inherit a vast fortune from a distant relative, he thinks his problems are solved. But the gay couple’s long running relationship is thrown into chaos when they find out there are strings attached. Albin must marry and produce a heir within eighteen months or the whole inheritance will be forfeited. Despite consultations with marriage brokers and all the best intentions, it seems nothing will assist Albin reach his reward - until help arrives in an unlikely form. Cast includes Ugo Tognazzi, Marcel Bozzuffi, Michel Galabru and Antonella Interlenghi. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: La Bamba (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Columbia, New Visions Pictures, Taylor Hackford and Luis Valdez
results.brief_description: Musical biography of Ritchie Valens, a poor Mexican-American who became a rock’n’roll sensation at age 17 in the 1950’s. Lou Diamond Phillips portrays Valens whose musical career ended when he was killed in the plane crash that also claimed the life of Buddy Holly. The music of Valens is performed by Los Lobos on the soundtrack.

results.title: L.A. Story
results.creator_credit: Daniel Melnick, Indieprod, L. A. Films and Mick Jackson
results.brief_description: Steve Martin wrote this romantic comedy, in which he stars as Harris K. Telemacher, a Los Angeles wacky weatherman extraordinaire. After growing increasingly distanced from his socialite girlfriend Trudi (Marilu Henner) and unhappy with his job, he finds his spirit renewed by the arrival of a British journalist (Victoria Tennant). An oddball, but very amusing look at the faux pas and foibles of life in modern Los Angeles.
